conbody.p: originsOracle CDC ClientOracle CDC Client originoverviewThe Oracle CDC Client processes change data capture (CDC) information provided by Oracle LogMiner redo logs. The Oracle CDC Client origin produces records with a map of fields and record header attributes with CDC information. Use Oracle CDC Client to process data from Oracle version 12c.
When needed, you can use a separate pipeline with the JDBC Consumer origin to read existing data before you start a pipeline with Oracle CDC Client.
The Oracle CDC Client origin can create records for insert, update, select-for-update, and delete operations for one or more tables in a database. You can select the operations that you want to use.

p.note: To use Oracle CDC Client, you must enable LogMiner for the database that you want to use and complete the necessary prerequisite tasks. The origin uses JDBC to access the database.

conbody.p: When you configure Oracle CDC Client, you configure change data capture details, such as the database and tables to read from, how to read the initial change, the dictionary source location, and the operations to include.

You also specify JDBC connection information and user credentials. If the database was created in a pluggable database, state the pluggable database name. You can configure custom properties that the driver requires.
